raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much. What are you doing?
System: Just listening to some music. You?
User: I'm at work.
System: What kind of job do you have, if you don't mind me asking?
User: I'm a programmer.
System: Oh cool! Do you like it?
User: Yes.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Nothing much, how about you
System: Not much either.
User: What are you doing
System: Playing Terraria. What about you?
User: Sitting in a meeting
System: What kind of meeting?
User: Can't say
System: It's probably boring, isn't it?
User: Haha, yes!
System: What is the meeting about?
User: I cannot tell you
System: What can you tell me?
User: Nothing much except that the weather is pleasant

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! What's up???
User: Nothing much, how you doin?
System: I'm in New York this week for Thanksgiving. I'm squatting in the office today and I caught up with an old friend of mine :D
User: Oh wow! Sounds like fun! When was the last time you had seen this friend?
System: The last time in New York, back in June.
User: Ohh okay. I was going to say if it had been a long time maybe it'd be awkward...
System: Haha, I guess if it's been a very long time there's almost too many life events to catch up on.. especially recently
User: Oh really? Has a lot changed in your life recently?
System: Haha it's probably too much to go into at the moment. Let's just say life is an exciting experience. How about you?
User: Ahhh sounds exciting indeed! My life is pretty bland. I like routine, but sometimes I wish I had more time for adventures!
System: What kinds of adventures?? Any ones that I would be able to join you on?
User: Hmmmm. I really want to try bull riding. Do you have any interest in that?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Wow, hello. Can't believe we are finally talking!
User: Yeah, sorry for the long gap! I heard you took a break and were travelling around the world. How was the travel?
System: It was an interesting trip. I got to see some exotic places. For example, I hiked the Son Doong cave in Vietnam. It's the biggest and deepest cave in the world.
User: Great! Vietnam is still in my TODO bucket list. Did you also visit cambodia and other neighboring places?
System: Yes. Laos and Cambodia are the two neighboring countries. Cambodia has an exotic culture. They sell spiders, scorpions, and grasshoppers as street food! It took a lot of courage for me to try them.
User: Hehe! How long was the stay?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I want a recommendation for a holiday destination
System: Have you tried asking your friends which one they like?
User: I have, but I'm looking for your point of view
System: What was the reply? Have you tried looking in a newspaper article?
User: Sorry? I said I want your point of view
System: It's OK. After all, you are only human. My opinion is of no consequence.
User: Yours is the opinion I want

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how's it going?
User: Pretty good. How about you?
System: I'm good, what you been up to?
User: I just got back from the beach
System: That's nice, how was it?
User: Soo beautiful. It was so sunny and warm
System: That's awesome, I haven't been to a beach in a while but I'd love to go again
User: Yeah it's certainly a nice break from doing work
System: What's your line of work?
User: I do machine learning research
System: That's cool, where did you go to school?
User: I didn't go to school. I'm self-taught

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What is the capital of Brazil?
System: I think the capital of Brazil is called "Brasilia".
User: How many people live there?
System: Is unknown a country? I only know countries, not towns or cities.
User: Do more people live in the USA or Australia?
System: Not that much more, no.
User: What other subjects do you know about besides Geography?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What's the strangest dream you've ever had?
User: All my dreams are strange. Well, at least, most of them are.
System: What about the ones that aren't strange?
User: Do you sometimes have dreams that are completely mundane? I do. Then I wake up and think "Oh, how disappointing."
System: Yeah. But at least it's not a nightmare.
User: Right, fair point, I should count my blessings.
System: Yep. It doesn't have to be a fun dream, just not a nightmare!
User: I suddenly feel I should ask: am I dreaming now?
System: Do you think you're dreaming?
User: I'm not sure. This could be one of my mundane dreams about everyday life.

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hello!
User: any improvements in your marathon time?
System: No, only a few minutes. I still find it difficult to run long races
User: I see. Are you planning to do any sporting events in the coming months?
System: I think a triathalon would be cool
User: I like doing Spartan race. It's an obstacle race which is challenging but not overtly so like marathons and triathlons
System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?
User: It has abt 20 obstacles like crossing high walls, monkey bars, etc. Its fun
